column4: hello i have the following problem, i deleted my partition table and recovered it with testdisk however testdisk maked my linux partition as ext2 and not ext3 anybody up for some help?
use fdisk to change the system lavel
have you used fdisk or cfdisk to change partition type?
yes but the partition type was already Linux
should i try it anyways again
dunno... i do not know how testdisk works... but you can convert and etx2 fs to ext3 easily
but i do not want to lose my data
you can convert between the two without loosing data. In linux we take backwards compat seriusly ;)
have you checjed the partitions with fsck or similar tool?
i tryed fsck but i got The superblock could not be read or does not describe a correct ext2 ... even tough i mounted the partition as ext3
the fsck should be done on the unmounted filesystem (from livecd for example)
also and you might try running e2fsck with an alternate superblock:
yes if it doesn't find the superblock you may want to try with fsck -b 32768
ok now fsck worked and returns a semly endless list of errors
i pressed yes to a lot of them, hopefully this eill not delete anything??? *scared*
i honestly dunno :| never been on the situation of lost the partitions of my hd
